data.question: Who runs the Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology?
data.answer: Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology (VIIT) is run by the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust (BRACT), Pune.

data.question: When was Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust (BRACT) established?
data.answer: Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust (BRACT) was established on the 16th of June, 1975 under the Bombay Trust Act of 1950.

data.question: What are the objectives of Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust?
data.answer: The objectives of the Trust include offering technical and medical education, establishing research centers, helping needy students, and felicitating scholars and artists.

data.question: What is the vision of the Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology?
data.answer: The vision of VIIT is 'Excellence in Technical Education with Holistic Development'.

data.question: What is the mission of the Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology?
data.answer: The mission of VIIT is to make industry-ready engineers with high human values and impart technical, social, and entrepreneurial skills of the highest standards.

data.question: Who is the current Director of VIIT?
data.answer: The current Director of VIIT is Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande, who holds a Doctorate from Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University and has over 31 years of experience.

data.question: What is the educational background of Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande?
data.answer: Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande holds Bachelor's and Master's degrees in Electronics & Telecommunications from Savitribai Phule Pune University and a Doctorate from Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University.

data.question: What are the research interests of Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande?
data.answer: Dr. Vivek S. Deshpande's research interests include Wireless Sensor Networks, embedded systems, IoT, Industry 4.0, and High-Performance Computer Networks.

data.question: Which undergraduate programmes are offered at VIIT?
data.answer: VIIT offers undergraduate programmes in Artificial Intelligence & Data Science, Civil Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science & Engineering (Artificial Intelligence), Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, and Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering.

data.question: How long is the duration of the undergraduate programmes at VIIT?
data.answer: The duration of the undergraduate programmes at VIIT is 4 years.

data.question: Which postgraduate programmes are offered at VIIT?
data.answer: VIIT offers postgraduate programmes in Computer Engineering.

data.question: What doctoral programmes are available at VIIT?
data.answer: VIIT offers doctoral programmes in Civil Engineering, Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering.

data.question: Which institutions are run by the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust?
data.answer: Institutions run by the Trust include VIT (Vishwakarma Institute of Technology), VIIT (Vishwakarma Institute of Information Technology), VV (Vishwakarma Vidyalaya), VCACS (Vishwakarma College of Arts, Commerce, Science), VU (Vishwakarma University), and others.

data.question: What social activities are conducted by Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust?
data.answer: The Trust conducts social activities such as charity work, donating medical facilities, awarding 'Adishakti Purskar' to eminent women, and organizing lecture series during Navaratra Festival.

data.question: Who is the Chief Trustee of Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust?
data.answer: Shri Rajkumar Bansilal Agarwal is the Chief Trustee of the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust.

data.question: Which institution does Vishwakarma Vidyalaya belong to?
data.answer: Vishwakarma Vidyalaya (VV) is a part of the Bansilal Ramnath Agarwal Charitable Trust, located in Bibwewadi, Pune.

data.question: What grade did VIIT receive from NAAC in its second cycle?
data.answer: VIIT received an 'A' grade from NAAC for its second cycle.

data.question: Which programs at VIIT were reaccredited by NBA in 2022?
data.answer: The programs reaccredited by NBA in 2022 at VIIT are Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering, and Civil Engineering.

data.question: What certifications does VIIT hold?
data.answer: VIIT holds certifications for EOMS 21000:2019, EMS: ISO 14001:2015, and ISO 2001-2015.

data.question: What is VIIT's India rank according to the 2023 DataQuest Top Schools ranking?
data.answer: VIIT is ranked 46th in India according to the 2023 DataQuest Top Schools ranking.

data.question: What was VIIT's rank in the CSR-GHRDC 2023 rankings?
data.answer: VIIT was ranked 13th in India and 6th in Maharashtra according to the CSR-GHRDC 2023 rankings.

data.question: What rank did VIIT achieve in The Week's 2023 India rankings for private institutes?
data.answer: VIIT achieved the 78th rank for private institutes in India according to The Week's 2023 rankings.

data.question: What awards did VIIT win at SUPRA 2023?
data.answer: At SUPRA 2023, VIIT won the Best Engine Tuning Award, Cleanest Pit Award, and was the first team to clear Technical Inspection. They also ranked 7th overall in SAE Supra and 8th in PiEV overall India.

data.question: What was VIIT's overall rank in the SAE BAJA 2023 competition?
data.answer: VIIT's overall static rank in SAE BAJA 2023 was AIR-5.

data.question: What services does the Accounts Section provide for students at VIIT?
data.answer: The Accounts Section provides services for students such as fee collection, fee refunds, scholarships, issuance of fee certificates and loan documents, support for student activities, and payments under the Earn & Learn Scheme.

data.question: Who is the Deputy Registrar of the Establishments Section at VIIT?
data.answer: The Deputy Registrar of the Establishments Section at VIIT is Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar.

data.question: What are the responsibilities of the Students Section at VIIT?
data.answer: The Students Section at VIIT is responsible for roll call preparation, student registration on ERP, issuance of certificates, transcript preparation, admissions, scholarship management, I-Card distribution, student data management, and the detention process if required.

data.question: What is the main aim of the Administrative Department of V.I.I.T.?
data.answer: The main aim of the Administrative Department of V.I.I.T. is to provide satisfactory service to the external customers, i.e., the students and parents, and the internal customers, which is the staff of V.I.I.T.

data.question: What sections is the Administrative Department functionally divided into?
data.answer: The Administrative Department is functionally divided into four sections: Establishment, Accounts, Students, and Examination Section.

data.question: Who is the Deputy Registrar of V.I.I.T.?
data.answer: Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar is the Deputy Registrar of V.I.I.T.

data.question: What is the contact number for Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar?
data.answer: The contact number for Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar is 020 26950207 (Direct) and 020 26950206 (Section).

data.question: What is the personal email of Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar?
data.answer: Mr. Vishal Vasudev Pattar's personal email is vishal.pattar@viit.ac.in.

data.question: What are the responsibilities of the Establishments Section?
data.answer: The Establishments Section handles planning and execution of visits of various expert committees, approvals for affiliation from AICTE, S.P.P.U., DTE, staff recruitment, promotions and retirements, maintaining staff service and leave records, teacher approvals from SPPU, documenting meetings, and managing inward and outward documents.

data.question: Who is the Accounts Officer at V.I.I.T.?
data.answer: Mr. Prakash Pise is the Accounts Officer at V.I.I.T.

data.question: What services does the Accounts Section provide for students?
data.answer: The Accounts Section provides services related to collection of fees, refund of fees, scholarships/freeship/fee waivers, issuance of fee certificates, student activities support, and payments under the earn and learn scheme.

data.question: What are the responsibilities of the Accounts Section related to staff?
data.answer: The Accounts Section is responsible for monthly pay bill preparation, TDS, Provident Fund, and professional tax payments, gratuity policy renewal and claims, welfare fund payments, research project grants verification, and settlement of PF claims.

data.question: What activities are included under Accounts activities?
data.answer: Accounts activities include maintenance of accounts, institutional transactions, banking transactions, petty cash management, internal and statutory audits, budget preparation, and implementation of fees as per Shikshan Shulka Samiti.

data.question: What does the Students Section handle?
data.answer: The Students Section handles preparation of roll calls, student registration, issuing certificates, admissions, submission of eligibility to SPPU, scholarship management, I-Card distribution, and updating student information.

data.question: What are the email addresses for Mr. G. H. Chavhan?
data.answer: Mr. G. H. Chavhan's email address is dr-ss@viit.ac.in and the section email is studentsection@viit.ac.in.

data.question: What are some of the responsibilities of the Students Section?
data.answer: Responsibilities of the Students Section include preparing provisional and final roll calls, issuing various certificates, handling admissions, managing scholarships, updating student data, and preparing Google forms for gathering information.

data.question: What is the purpose of the 'Schedule of Additional Institute Level Counselling Round'?
data.answer: The purpose is to inform students about the upcoming counseling rounds for admissions, specifically for the academic year 2024-25.

data.question: When was the notice regarding 'Admissions 2024-25' published?
data.answer: The notice regarding Admissions 2024-25 was published on 03.10.2024.

data.question: What information is included in the 'VIT First Year B. Tech Admissions' announcement?
data.answer: The announcement includes details about reporting venues for first-year B. Tech admissions for the academic year 2024-25.

data.question: What recent change has been communicated regarding the VIT-Bibwewadi and VIIT-Kondhwa institutes?
data.answer: There has been a circular regarding the merger of VIT-Bibwewadi and VIIT-Kondhwa, Pune.

data.question: What type of conference is mentioned in the text, and what is its focus?
data.answer: The text mentions the '3rd IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Distributed Systems,' indicating a focus on advancements in blockchain technology and distributed systems.

data.question: What does the acronym 'IQAC' stand for, and what is its role?
data.answer: IQAC stands for Internal Quality Assurance Cell. Its role includes ensuring quality in education and maintaining standards within the institution.

data.question: How can students find information about internships and industrial visits at VIIT?
data.answer: Students can find information about internships and industrial visits under the 'Industry Connect' section, which details industry advisory boards, internships, and industrial visits organized by the institute.

data.question: What support does the 'From Desk of TPO' section provide?
data.answer: The 'From Desk of TPO' section provides insights into placement activities, recruiter collaborations, placement summaries, and training opportunities for students.

data.question: What initiatives does the 'Research & Development' section highlight?
data.answer: The 'Research & Development' section highlights the Doctoral Research Centre and the Vishwakarma Research Scheme, aimed at promoting research activities within the institute.

data.question: Where can students find information about academic departments at VIIT?
data.answer: Students can find information about academic departments such as Civil Engineering, Computer Engineering, and others under the 'Departments' section of the VIIT website.
